content:
The relative risk reduction (RRR) can be calculated as follows:

RRR = (risk in the control group - risk in the treatment group) / risk in the control group

The risk of palpitations in the control group is 6/10 = 0.6, and the risk in the treatment group is 5/10 = 0.5. Substituting these values into the formula gives:

RRR = (0.6 - 0.5) / 0.6 = 0.17 or 17%

Therefore, the relative risk reduction associated with the therapy is 17%. Answer: (b)
